w:r.w:t: How often does Savvy index files?
Every 60 seconds
What’s our privacy policy?

We adhere to the highest industry standards for data security. Our data centers have strong TLS and data encryption to protect your company data. Savvy Staff will not view your data and you can remove your data from Savvy at any time. Each member of your Slack team must authenticate their unique cloud accounts to their personal Savvy account.Sharing permissions are preserved and never changed without permission. Data is never shared with anyone with your team without explicit permission from the owner of the data.
What browsers does Savvy support?
Google Chrome
Are you planning further extensions?
Safari - Q1 2018 (Jan-Feb)
Microsoft Edge - Q1 2018 (Jan-Feb)
Firefox - Q1 2018 (Jan-Feb)
Opera - Q2 2018 (Mar - Apr)
What content services does Savvy currently integrate with?
Google Drive (primarily Docs)

https://airtable.com/shrDXspvQrGxti2LM

This is where we get our images/graphics/illustrations from:
https://undraw.co/illustrations
What is Savvy?

Savvy is an app that lives where you work. It works on its own website, via a browser extension and Slack. It connects to the tools you use at work, like Google Drive, Dropbox, Trello and more, and allows you to find the answers to the questions you have wherever you are.

You interact with it in natural language. You can ask it questions like, “where are the latest financial projections” or “what’s our holiday policy?” It’ll return links to the best files and documents to answer your question.
Why do I and my team need Savvy?

Growing teams rely on a lot of tools to get their work done. Individuals pick their own “best tools” for the job and while this might feel like it raises productivity, it actually means more siloed information and difficulty finding the right thing to get your job done.
The problem gets worse as teams grow and teammates introduce their own unique sets of tools. Company information gets spread across these tools and becomes even less accessible.
Existing solutions don’t work:
Enterprise search - searching the company shared drive doesn’t solve anything because modern work information lives in other people's productivity tools.

Wikis and collaboration tools - anytime information is transcribed from its original source into a more “permanent” place, it becomes stale by definition. Nobody needs stale information. Answers should come directly from the source of the information.
Not doing anything - shoulder tapping, asking questions in slack and email repeatedly not only annoy colleagues and make the person asking the question feel helpless.
Answers for Slack
Do I need to be a Slack administrator to get set up?

In order to start asking Savvy questions, the app has to be installed in Slack. By default, Slack allows all users to install apps, but those permissions are sometimes restricted by administrators. In cases where installation of apps is restricted, an administrator will need to install Savvy. To view a full list of the admins on your team, visit the Account page at
my.slack.com/account/team
You can still connect your apps to Savvy while the app isn’t installed in your Slack team. Doing this will let you start using the product as soon the app is installed.
How can I invite my teammates to try Savvy?
Simply send them this link:
https://{teamname}.heysavvy.com
Pro tip: Try inviting Savvy to one of your favorite Slack channels. Anyone who interacts with Savvy will be able to get set-up right away.
What apps does Savvy work with?
Savvy currently connects to Google Drive (Docs, Sheets, etc), Dropbox, Evernote, Trello, Slack files and GMail.
How can I connect to a work app that isn’t listed on your website?
The best thing to do is let us know what apps you’d like to connect to Savvy!
Can I connect multiple accounts of the same work app to Savvy?
Yes! From
the dashboard

, connect your first account from the app and then click the connection card for that app again. From that page, you’ll be able to connect as many accounts of the same type as you’d like by clicking on the “Connect Additional” button.
This is particularly useful so that you can search across multiple work accounts, or across work and personal accounts, at the same time.
How long does it take to index my work apps?

The time to index your content depends on how much data you have in your work apps. We’ve seen this take minutes and it’s sometimes taken several hours. We do our best to index your most recent content first so you can get started using Savvy right away. If it takes more than a few hours, please contact
support@heysavvy.com
Pro tip: You can check the status of your index by heading to your connected app page.
How do I disconnect one of my work apps?
From
the dashboard

, click the icon for the app you’d like to disconnect. From there, you’ll be taken to a page where you can see your connection details for that app. On that page, click the account you want to disconnect.
How do I interact with the Savvy product?
Savvy
is an app in Slack that answers your questions about where your information lives.
Open Slack and send @Savvy a direct message in the form of a question.
Can I search a specific work app?
Yes! You can just tell Savvy to only search that specific app. For example:
Find the latest contractor agreement in Google Drive
That will restrict Savvy from searching any of your connected apps besides Google Drive.
How can I filter my Savvy search?
You can describe what you’re looking for using:
Dates and date ranges - from last week
Specific apps - in Google Drive
Exact phrases - “statement of work”
To put it all together, you could ask Savvy
“Statement of work” in Google Drive from last week
Can I search for text inside of a PDF?
Yes! Savvy indexes the contents of common documents types like PDFs, MS Office documents, and Google documents.
Can I search for text or objects inside a picture?
Not yet, but we’ll announce as soon as Savvy has image recognition.
Can I invite Savvy to multiple Slack Teams?
You can add Savvy to as many Slack teams as you'd like. Once Savvy is added to a team, anyone on your team can message Savvy, connect their work apps, and get answers.
What does Savvy do with the feedback I give it?

Clicking the thumbs up button teaches Savvy about the types of content you and your team are interested in. As with any feedback you provide, Savvy gets better at understanding you and finding what you need.
Which languages does Savvy support?
Currently, Savvy only responds in English.
Does Savvy work in my Slack channels?

Yes! When you ask @Savvy a question in a channel, it will always respond in a private direct message. You can invite Savvy to a channel with a simple slash command. Just type /invite @Savvy to send the invitation.
You will be given the option of what to share, if anything, with the channel.
Pricing
How does Savvy’s pricing work?

Savvy is free for 14-Days with all our features on our ‘Free Trial’. Depending on your usage you’ll be recommended a £5 (standard), £25 (marketing/HR) and £45 (Sales) per user per month package. Billing starts after the day your team’s trial expires. Savvy Enterprise is available for teams over 20 users.
Contact us
for pricing
Do you offer a free trial?
Yes.
Savvy is free for 14-Day on our ‘Free Trial’ for teams of up to 25 people. For teams larger than 25 people, our Enterprise plan works best and also includes 14 Free Days.
Do you offer enterprise plans?
Yes. Get in touch to learn more [here].
We need to add more people to our team. How is that billed?

We’ll make a one-time pro-rated charge to your credit card to cover your new team member’s account for the remainder of the current billing period. That user will be added to your standard billing cycle on the first of the following month.
Trust, Security and Safety
Is any of my information searchable by my teammates?
No. Your data is private and confidential, and so are your conversations with Savvy.
If you have any questions, please see
our privacy policy
Can the humans at Savvy see my data?
No. We are strictly bound by our privacy policy and do not allow our employees to have access to private user data.
For more information, please see
our privacy policy
Why does Savvy need access to the content in my work apps?
Without accessing your content, Savvy won’t be able to deliver search results.
How does Savvy handle permissions levels?
Savvy respects all of the permissions you have set for your files and documents. It does not modify permissions in any way without your explicit instruction to do so.
For example, you would have to tell Savvy to share a particular document with a colleague for anyone else to get access to that content.
Can I exclude folders from being indexed?

When you connect Savvy to your work apps, those apps determine what folders the Savvy service has access to. Most work apps don’t allow restricting particular folders from being connected to external sources.
More importantly, anything you connect to Savvy remains private. For more information, please see
our privacy policy
Do you store my passwords?
No. We never get access to your passwords nor will we ever ask for your passwords
